create-page--button: Text on a button to create a new copy of the primary page.
create-page-cancel--label:
Cancel/close the modal dialog box to create a new copy.
{{identical|Cancel}}
create-page-create--label: A button to start creating a new copy of a primary page on a given wiki.
create-page-error--title: Error message shown when the new page was not created.
create-page-error-wd--title:
An error shown if a new wiki page was created, but it was not possible to add it to the wikidata sitelinks (translations).

Parameters:
* $1 link to the new page
* $2 link to Wikidata
* $3 error message
create-page-header--label: Text of the link that opens new page popup. Shown in a list of dependencies.
create-page-page--label: Text next to the input box to choose the page to copy.
create-page-page--placeholder: This text is shown inside the input when its empty.
create-page-success--title: Shown when a new page is created, with a link to the new page.
create-page-target--label: An input text box with the name of the new page to be created - localized.
create-page-target--placeholder: In case the page name is empty, this will be shown as gray text.
create-page-wiki--info:
Info text shown once the user selects a page to copy.

* $1 - number of wikis that have this page
* $2 - total number of wikis known to the system
create-page-wiki--label: A label shown next to the input field to select the destination wiki where the page should be copied to.
create-page-wiki--placeholder: If target wiki input field is empty, this text is shown in gray.
dataloader-toast-success--copies:
Shown on startup -- indicates how many page copies exist that have been loaded from the server (not to be confused with pages - a much smaller number)

* $1 number of copies
dataloader-toast-success--pages:
Shown on startup -- indicates how many pages exist that have been loaded from the server (not to be confused with copies - a much higher number)

* $1 number of pages
dataloader-toast-success--title:
Appears in a bubble at the bottom of the screen shortly after entering the Dibabel dashboard and lists what data was loaded, for example: Loaded data
23 pages

3236 copies
diff-content--loading: Info text shown while downloading the latest page changes.
diff-content--loading-error: An error shown when it was not possible to get the latest changes to the page.
diff-content--login-error: In right to left languages, it's "upper left".
diff-deps-button--caption: Link text that shows the slideout with the information about the dependent page
diff-deps-button-new--caption: A link that opens a new page dialog box to create a new copy of the missing dependency.
diff-deps-header--status: Header of the dependencies table with the status.
diff-deps-header--title: Name of the page that this page depends on
diff-deps-none--label: In case the page does not depend on anything else, shows this message.
diff-deps-status--manual-sync: A dependent page is synchronized by hand - the system will only check if the page exists on the target wiki, but will not check page content.
diff-deps-status--missing: Shown as a dependency status if the dependent page does not exist.
diff-deps-status--no-copy:
Shown if a module or a template is a multisite page, but a certain wiki doesn't have it yet.

$1 is a URL, such as ru.wikivoyage.org
diff-deps-status--no-sync: The standard translation of "multi-site page" into your language should be a label on Wikidata at [https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q63090714 item Q63090714].
diff-header-description--diverged:
If a page is changed on a wiki (local edit), and that change no longer matches any of the revisions of the primary page, treat that page as "diverged", and show this message in the page description.

* $1 is the link to the copied page.
* $2 is the link to the primary page.
diff-header-description--ok:
In the page info, this will be shown if someone copied the page "as is", without any localisations (like renaming modules/templates to their localized version).

* $1 is the link to the page copy.
* $2 is the link to the primary page.
diff-header-description--outdated:
Shown in the page info when the page has not been updated from the primary version for some number of revisions.  E.g. when the primary page is edited, all pages in sync before would become 1 revision behind.

* $1 is a link to the copy.
* $2 is a link to the primary's history page comparing last N revisions. This text is generated with the [dibabel-diff-header-description--outdated-rev] message.
* $3 is a link to the primary page.
diff-header-description--outdated-rev: Used as parameter in {{msg-dibabel|dibabel-diff-header-description--outdated}} to indicate the number of revisions that has changed since the copy was updated.
diff-header-warnings--diverged: Explanation text for the diverged pages - header line.
diff-header-warnings--diverged-1: one of the reasons to override diverged changes.
diff-header-warnings--diverged-2: one of the reasons to override diverged changes.
diff-header-warnings--diverged-3: one of the reasons to override diverged changes.
diff-summary--placeholder: Gray text appearing in the summary edit box when no text is entered. This will almost never be shown, and might be deleted later.
diff-summary--tooltip: This is a tooltip text shown when the user hovers over the link to translatewiki.
diff-summary-text--edit:
Edit summary when the local page has fallen behind from the original, and the user is updating it to the latest.

Parameter:
* $1 - change count
* $2 - list of users who made changes
* $3 - combined text of summary messages
* $4 link to the source page.
diff-summary-text--empty-summary: Text that gets displayed instead of the edit summary, when it was left empty
diff-summary-text--localized:
Edit summary when the local page is identical to the original, and namespaces, module names and template names need to be translated to the local wiki. 

* $1 is a link to the primary version of the page.
diff-summary-text--new:
Edit summary when the user is creating a new copy of the centrally stored page to a wiki.

* $1 is a link to the primary version of the page.
diff-summary-text--reset:
Edit summary when the local page has diverged from the original, and the user is overwriting it with the current content from the primary page.

* $1 is a link to the primary version of the page.
diff-update:
Used as label for the Submit button.
{{Identical|Update}}
filters-groupby--hash: One of the table grouping options -- groups all copies by their current content expressed as a unique fingerprint number.
filters-groupby--lang: One of the table grouping options -- groups all copies by the language of the wiki.
filters-groupby--placeholder: A placeholder on a drop down. Possible values: by language, by wiki, etc.
filters-groupby--project: One of the table grouping options -- groups all copies by the project (wikipedia/wikiquote/...)
filters-groupby--site: One of the table grouping options -- groups all copies by wiki site (en.wikipedia, fr.wikipedia, fr.wikibooks, ...)
filters-groupby--title: One of the table grouping options -- groups all copies by the multi-site page title.
filters-lang:
A button to filter the list to the specific wiki language(s).
{{identical|Language}}
filters-lang--unknown: Shown as one of the language names when the wiki has no specific language, e.g. Commons.
filters-project:
A button to filter the list to the specific projects, e.g. wikipedia, wikibooks, etc.
{{identical|Project}}
filters-searchbar--placeholder: A gray text shown in the search bar to give examples of what can be searched for.  Feel free change the language code.
filters-status: A button to filter the list to the specific status (ok/outdated/diverged/...)
filters-type: A button to filter the list to the specific page type (module or template)
filters-type--modules: One of the values in the page type filter.
filters-type--templates: One of the values in the page type filter.
filters-wiki: A button to filter the list to the specific wikis.
header-description:
A title at the top of the page.

* $1 is replaced by a link to the Wikimedia user page of the tool's author.
header-links--bugs: A link at the top of the page. Links to [https://github.com/nyurik/dibabel-js/issues issue tracking on GitHub].
header-links--help:
A link at the top of the page. Links to [[:mw:Multilingual Templates and Modules]].
{{identical|Help}}
header-links--source:
A link at the top of the page. Links to [https://github.com/nyurik/dibabel-js the source code of the tool on GitHub].
{{identical|Source}}
language-filter--placeholder: When changing site language, and there are many translations available, this text will be shown as a gray placeholder in the search box to quickly locate the needed language.
language-help: Link to translation page on translatewiki, to encourage the user to help translate
language-unknown: Describes an unknown language, in the Language menu ({{msg-dibabel|dibabel-filters-lang}}).
settings-gear--aria: Tooltip that shows when the user hovers over the gear icon (settings dropdown)
settings-logout: logout current user (link in the settings menu)
settings-options: Header text in the settings menu
settings-search--label: label next to the on/off switch to enable "search as you type" in the search bar.  Enabled by default, could be slow on slower computers.
settings-theme--label: Enable dark theme of the application
sync-button--label:
This button text is shown whenever the user selects one or more pages to synchronize.

Parameters:
* $1 - number of selected pages (1 or more)
table-cell-diverged--tooltip: $1 pages have local modifications and must be synchronized individually.
table-cell-outdated--tooltip: $1 pages are behind the primary and can be synchronized automatically.
table-cell-status--diverged-label: A status indicator in the table.
table-cell-status--diverged-tooltip: Tooltip for the icon next to {{msg-dibabel|dibabel-table-cell-status--diverged-label}}
table-cell-status--ok--tooltip: Tooltip for the icon next to {{msg-dibabel|dibabel-table-cell-status--ok-label}}
table-cell-status--ok-label:
'''This is not an OK button!'''

A status indicator in the table.

It should probably be the same as {{msg-dibabel|dibabel-filters-status-ok}}.
table-cell-status--outdated-label:
A status indicator in the table.

* $1 is the number of revisions.
table-cell-status--outdated-link: Show what changed in the last $1 revisions of the primary $2 in a new tab.
table-cell-status--outdated-tooltip: Tooltip for the icon next to {{msg-dibabel|dibabel-table-cell-status--outdated-label}}
table-cell-status--unlocalized-label: A status indicator in the table.
table-cell-status--unlocalized-tooltip: Tooltip for the icon next to {{msg-dibabel|dibabel-table-cell-status--unlocalized-label}}
table-cell-unlocalized--tooltip: $1 pages are identical to the original. These pages need to be localized because some dependent templates may have different names on that wiki. This can be done automatically.
table-header-wikipage--link: Tooltip for the icon next to a link in a table. $1 and $2 are page titles.
table-icons-protection--rights: Tooltip for a lock icon on a row.
table-icons-protection--tooltip: Tooltip for a lock icon at the top of the table.
